availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To the Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your Petitioner respectfully represents that on the 30th day of June last he was in Stamping Ground Ky and while there he happened to meet with one of his Neighbors, between whom, and this Affiant, there was a misunderstanding in regard to some land, and in conversation with Said Neighbor, this affiant became became Somewhat excited, Because he that he had been badly treated, and affiant whilst being so excited Swore, and probably created some disturbance. for which he was fined the sum of Ten dollars, by the Police Justice of the Peace of said Town
Your Petitioner respectfuly asks that Said fine be remitted as there was no personal conflict, or blow struck on the occasion and no damage done to any one.
We respectfully unite in the prayer of the above petition

A H Rennick
William Morris
H R Miller
G C Hughes
W. J. Chinn
J. Harlan
W Franklin
H B. James
G W. Craddock
Jno. Rodman
M. B. Chinn
